result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert S Clyburn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: sentence currently being served

superMiscConds.notes: lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Defendant shall have no contact with Hechimovich or Bahrens Tool and Die.

Defendant shall not use or possess any financial information or documents that bears a name other than his own.
